title: Self-Service
intent: Reduce coordination cost and delays by letting a system or user perform needed actions independently.

triz_principle.name: Self-Service
triz_principle.definition: Make an object serve itself by performing auxiliary functions independently.

problem_understanding.core_contradiction: Centralized control ensures quality, but it creates queues, delays, and dependency on gatekeepers.
problem_understanding.why_this_hurts: Every request waiting for approval or execution by another team increases lead time and frustration.
typical_signals: high coordination overhead for simple changes

solution_logic.core_idea: Move routine actions closer to where the need arises.
solution_logic.key_rule: Centralize rules and guardrails, decentralize execution.
solution_logic.how_it_resolves_the_contradiction: Quality is preserved by constraints, while speed improves through autonomy.

consulting: self-service analytics instead of central reporting teams
decision playbooks enabling teams to act without escalation
clear guardrails instead of case-by-case approvals
software_engineering: developer portals for APIs and tooling
enterprise_sap: self-service master data requests with built-in validation

do_not_use_when: users lack necessary context or training

diagnostic_questions: Which requests are repetitive and predictable?
What rules could replace manual approval?
Where does waiting add no value?

example.before: Teams submit tickets for every small configuration change.
example.after: Teams adjust configurations themselves within predefined limits.
